ul.li: Shows the heading of the aircraft with respect to magnetic north.
Displays the amount and location of fuel remaining.
The totalizer digitally displays the number of pounds of fuel remaining in all internal and external tanks.
The AL and FR pointers show the fuel quantity in the tanks selected by the FUEL QTY SEL knob.
Normally, the FWD tank fuel quantity is up to 600 pounds greater than the AFT tank fuel quantity.
If there is an excessive disparity between the tanks, a red portion of the AL pointer becomes visible.
Fuel distribution can be changed by rotating the ENGINE FEED knob as desired to correct excessive fuel imbalance.

area.title: Pilot Fault List Display (PFLD)
area.impl: PFLD only displays one PFL at a time

ul.li: Displays fault lists from the engine, avionics and FLCS systems.
A status line displays a system code, to identify a system associated with an active fault.
Two types of PFLs are displayed: warning level and caution level.
Each page of the PFLD displays up to three PFLs; additional PFLs are accessed by pressing the F-ACK button.
System A (top).
System B (bottom).
0 to 4000 pounds.
Indicates the percentage of hydrazine fuel remaining.
In the case of main engine failure, the EPU will burn ~10% fuel per minute.

area.title: Cabin Pressure Altimeter
area.impl: Display reads 25k ft when the cabin is pressurized and 0 ft when pressurization is lost regardless of aircraft altitude

ul.li: Indicates pressure altitude inside the cockpit.
Indicates local time.
In the real plane, the big knob winds it and the little knob rotates the 60-second faceplate.
If a failure occurs and using the F-ACK button, it shows information about the actual status of the systems.
Cause: One or more failures in the FLCS control system.
Action: Assess PFL(s); Press F-ACK button to review PFLs and reset the FLCS FAULT caution light; Reset FLCS.
Cause: Indicates and engine fault PFL item was detected.
Action: Assess PFL(s); Press F-ACK button to review PFLs and reset the ENGINE FAULT caution light.
Cause: Indicates avionics fault(s) or MUX failure.
Action: Assess PFL(s); Press F-ACK button to review PFLs and reset the AVIONICS FAULT caution light.
Cause: Ejection seat not armed.
Action: Arm seat.
Cause: Failure(s) in the electrical system.
Action: Refer to the ELEC panel for specific info; Press the ELEC CAUTION RESET button.
Cause: Running on secondary engine controls.
Appears during start-up while JFS spools engine.
Appears if the Engine Control Switch is placed in the SEC position.
Action:.
If during start-up wait until light extinguishes before moving past Idle Cutoff.
Place Engine Control Switch in PRI position.
Cause: Avionics equipment cooling air temperature/ pressure insufficient.
Action: Confirm AIR SOURCE knob in NORM & keep engine below 80% RPM; Land.
Cause: Nose wheel steering malfunction.
Action: Land/taxi accordingly.
Cause: Failure of probe heater or monitoring system.
Action: AOA/Airspeed sensors degraded; Avoid areas of known or suspected icing conditions.
Cause: Excessive temperature of engine oil.
Action: Assess PFL(s); Land.
Cause: Radar altimeter malfunction.
Action: Reference barometric altimeter; Switch Radar altimeter off.
Cause: Anti-skid wheel brake system malfunction.
Cause: Central Air Data Computer internal malfunction.
Cause: Ice formation on engine inlet.
Cause: IFF MODE 4 REPLY failure.
Cause: Hook is not retracted and locked.
Action: Raise hook.
Cause: Cat I/III stores configuration switch in the wrong position for stores loaded.
Action: Change stores configuration switch position.
Cause: Engine damaged/ overheat condition.
Action: Reduce throttle to minimum requirement to avoid engine explosion/failure.
Cause: Malfunction in nuclear control circuitry.
Cause: Liquid oxygen supply below 0.5 liter or pressure below 42 PSI.
Action: Descend to < FL 180.
Automatic Terrain Following system malfunction.
Electronic Engine Control.
Indicates an EEC self-failure or input failure.
Cause: Loss of cabin pressurization.
Action: Check AIR SOURCE knob for NORM position; Descend below FL 250 and < 500 kts.
Cause: Less than 400 lbs of fuel in aft fuel tank which may be caused by low fuel, a fuel leak, trapped external fuel, a fuel imbalance between the forward and aft systems, or a fuel sensing problem.
Action: Transfer/balance fuel load and/or reduce fuel flow; Land ASAP.
Backup Fuel Control selected and engine operating in BUC or when main fuel pump pressure is low.
Cause: Less than 400 lbs of fuel in aft fuel tank which may be caused by low fuel, a fuel leak, trapped external fuel, a fuel imbalance between the forward and aft systems, or a fuel sensing problem.
Action: Transfer/balance fuel load and/or reduce fuel flow; Land ASAP.
